means: 把…造成棘齿形，于…作棘齿，在…上刻锯齿

sentence.Network_en: He fears inflation will ratchet up as the year ends.
sentence.Network_cn: 他害怕通货膨胀会在年终更加严重。

sentence.Network_en: A ratchet mechanism transfers the thread from spool to bobbin.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种棘齿装置把线从线轴转到梭心上。

sentence.Network_en: The chair has a ratchet below it to adjust the height.
sentence.Network_cn: 这把椅子下面有棘轮调整高度。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French rochet, originally denoting a blunt lance head, later in the sense 'bobbin, ratchet'; related to the base of archaic rock 'quantity of wool on a distaff for spinning'

entry.def: In a tool or machine, a ratchet is a wheel or bar with sloping teeth, which can move only in one direction, because a piece of metal stops the teeth from moving backwards.

example.ex: The chair has a ratchet below it to adjust the height...
example.tran: 这把椅子下面有棘轮调整高度。

example.ex: A ratchet mechanism transfers the thread from spool to bobbin.
example.tran: 一种棘齿装置把线从线轴转到梭心上。

entry.def: If a tool or machine ratchets or if you ratchet it, it makes a clicking noise as it operates, because it has a ratchet in it.

example.ex: The rod bent double, the reel shrieked and ratcheted...
example.tran: 操作杆进一步弯曲，线轴发出刺耳的吱吱声。

example.ex: She took up a sheet and ratcheted it into the typewriter.
example.tran: 她拿起一张纸，把它哗哗啦啦地塞到打字机中。

entry.def: If you describe a situation as a ratchet, you mean that it is bad and can only become worse.

example.ex: ...another raising of the ratchet of violence in the conflict.
example.tran: 冲突中又一次的暴力升级

means.word_mean: 1. mechanical device consisting of a toothed wheel or rack engaged with a pawl that permits it to move in only one direction
1. move by degrees in one direction only;

auth_sentence.content: Both parties, in any case, have continued to ratchet up the partisanship.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both parties, in any case, have continued to ratchet up the partisanship.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both parties, in any case, have continued to ratchet up the partisanship.
